result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Adam Schwickrath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $600.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.    DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:55 PM: Defendant Michael Adam Schwickrath in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  DA serves a copy of the Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today and is prepared to resolve matter today.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1 (POT):  GP  Plea Ct 3 (OAR 2):  GP  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Ct 2 (POP) DRI and 15TR-382.  DA argues for Court Costs as to Ct 1 and guideline penalty as to Ct 3.  Statement by Def:  Speaks as to prior offenses and any possible Co Jail time.  The Court as to Ct 1:  Imposes Court Costs only - 60 DTP or PP.  As to Ct 3:  Explains sentencing guidelines that must be followed - imposes 5 days WCJ - Report 6/1/15 at 8:00 PM - GT & Huber; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.  No bond to be applied - 60 DTP Costs to include DNA surcharge as to each count.    Def ordered to supply DNA sample today.  Def must complete ID process with WCSD.  Def advised of right to expunge DNA in the future with certain criteria being met.

Prior: 2265 Williams Point Dr, Stoughton, WI 53589
